body: Thank you, will patch this bug soon.

rename.from: Validation of field array with yup is not working properly (errors are not showing)
rename.to: Validation of field array with yup (min length error) is not working properly

body:
after careful analyze, here is a proposal for the fix:

because when there is no item in the array field, react hook form will submit data as `{}`, which means in order for the schema validation to validate correctly we will have to append `required()`. react hook form's input state live inside inputs instead local state, which is the reason why when you submit the form, if there is not array field item, it will simply be omitted.

take a look at the example below and let me know your thoughts, I think what can do to make it work with at least one item in an array filed with a schema.

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-fieldsarray-yup-validation-pcyvy?file=/src/index.js:493-509

an alternative **solution** would be trigger validation at `useEffect` when array becomes empty.
Thanks for the quick reply, the proposed solution will work for us. Also, you're doing an awesome job with the library (and support), many thanks :))
awesome, thanks @vilanelle I will put into a PR for this issue. thanks for the verification.
Hi @bluebill1049 could you provide any estimate when this problem could be solved?
I am busy trying to figure out a solution @szymexpawlowski, here is a ticket for you to track: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/1617
